name: (13)CH4 delta
description: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature). Isotopic ratio, expressed as deviations from an agreed-upon international reference measurement standard (which defines the corresponding isotope scales) using the delta notation: δ = (Rsample/Rreference – 1), with R = [rare isotope]/[abundant isotope].

name: (13)CO Delta
description: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CO (Carbon monoxide) (isotopic signature)

name: (13)CO2 Delta
description: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: (14)CH4 Delta
description: 3D field of Delta C-14 in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature)

name: (14)CO Number Concentration
description: 3D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide) with C-14 isotope (mol) per air volume (m3)

name: (14)CO2 Delta
description: 3D field of Delta C-14 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: Accumulated precipitation (over 24 h)
description: Integration of precipitation rate reaching the ground over several time intervals. The reference requirement refers to integration over 24 h

name: Aerosol Absorption Optical Depth
description: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol absorption coefficient: AAOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the absorption coefficient [km-1] and Δz the vertical path [km]

name: Aerosol column burden
description: 2D field of the column burden of condensed particles in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol dust concentration
description: 3-D field of concentration of dust or sand in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol effective radius
description: 3D field of mean aerosol particle size, defined as the ratio of the third and second moments of the number size distribution of aerosol particles.  Requested in the troposphere (assumed height: 12 km) and as columnar average.

name: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient
description: 3D field of spectral volumetric extinction cross-section of aerosol particles.

name: Aerosol Layer Height
description: Height of vertically localized aerosol layer in the free troposphere above sea level

name: Aerosol mass mixing ratio
description: 3D field of the mass mixing ratio of condensed particles in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol Optical Depth
description: The AOD is the effective depth of the aerosol column from the viewpoint of radiation propagation: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol extinction coefficient AOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ] and Δz the vertical path [km]

name: Aerosol single-scattering albedo
description: The spectrally dependent ratio of the aerosol scattering to the aerosol extinction

name: Aerosol species mole fraction
description: 3D field of the mole fraction of condensed-phase chemical species (e.g., sulfate, nitrate, ammonium, elemental carbon, organic carbon),  in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol species total column burden
description: 2D field integrated over the total column burden of concentration of condensed-phase chemical species (e.g., sulfate, nitrate, ammonium, elemental carbon, organic carbon), in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol type
description: Selection, out of a pre-defined set of aerosol classes, that best fits an input data set (observed or modeled). The pre-defined set of aerosol classes includes specification of the particle composition, mixing state, complex refractive index, and shape as a function of particle size. The definition of aerosol type includes specification of all the classes as well as the algorithm used to choose the best fit to the input data.

name: Aerosol volcanic ash
description: 3D field of mass mixing ratio of volcanic ash

name: Aerosol volcanic ash  Total Column
description: 2D Field of mass of volcanic ash, integrated over the total column.

name: Air pressure (near surface)
description: Air pressure at a known height above the surface with the height specified in the metadata

name: Air specific humidity (near surface)
description: Air specific humidity  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata. Specific  humidity is the ratio of the mass of water vapour and the mass of moist air.

name: Air temperature (near surface)
description: Air temperature at a known height above the surface with the height specified in the metadata

name: Alpha particles integral directional flux
description: An alpha particle has positive charge and consists of two protons and two neutrons (the nucleus of a helium atom). Flux is the rate of flow through a reference surface, measured in particles per unit area.The directional flux is the flux limited to a certain solid angle as a function of the direction (pitch angle).

name: Atmospheric density
description: 3D field of density of the atmosphere

name: Atmospheric temperature
description: 3D field of the atmospheric temperature

name: Aurora
description: Occurence of fluorescence of the upper atmosphere through ionization by energetic charged particles accelerated by the Earth's magnetic field.

name: Background Luminance (surface)
description: Luminous flux received from the background, per unit solid angle and per unit area where the Luminous flux is a quantity derived from radiant flux by evaluating the radiation according to its action upon the International Commission on Illumination standard photometric observer. (symbol: L; unit: lm. m<sup>–2<sub>.</sub></sup> sr<sup>–1</sup> = cd . m<sup>–2</sup> )

name: Biomass
description: Total amount of vegetation in a reference area - Physical unit: [ t/ha (tons/hectare) ] - Accuracy unit: [ t/ha ]

name: BrO
description: 3D field of amount of BrO (Bromine monoxide, expressed in moles)   divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C(17)OO Delta
description: 3D field of Delta O-17 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: C(18)O Delta
description: 3D field of Delta O-18 in CO (Carbon monoxide) (isotopic signature)

name: C(18)OO Delta
description: 3D field of Delta O-18 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: C10H16 (3-Carene) Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount  of C10H16 (3-Carene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C10H16 (alfapinene) Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount  of C10H16 (alfapinene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C10H16 (betapinene) Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of C10H16 (betapinene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C10H16 (Limonene) Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C10H16 (Limonene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C2H2
description: 3D field of amount of C2H2 (Acetylene. expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in air (also expressed in moles)

name: C2H5OH Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of C2H5OH (Ethanol, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C2H6
description: 3D field of amount of C2H6 (Ethane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C2H6S Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of C2H6S (Dimethyl sulphide, DMS, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) .

name: C3H6O Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount  of C3H6O (Acetone, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C3H8
description: 3D field of amount  of C3H8 (Propane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C4H10
description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C4H10 (Methylpropane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C4H10 (n-butane)
description: 3D field of amount dry of C4H10 (n-butane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C5H12 (2-Methylbutane)
description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C5H12 (2-Methylbutane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C5H12 (n-Pentane)
description: 3D field of amount of C5H12 (n-Pentane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C5H8
description: 3D field of amountof C5H8 (Isoprene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C6H6
description: 3D field of amount of C6H6 (Benzene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C7H8 Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C7H8 (Toluene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CFC-11
description: 3D field of amount of CFC-11 (Trichlorofluoromethane = Freon-11,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CFC-12
description: 3D field of amount of CFC-12 (Dichlorodifluoromethane = Freon-12, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) .

name: CH3Br
description: 3D field of amount of CH3Br (methil bromide, or bromomethane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CH3CN Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of CH3CN (Acetonitrile, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CH3D Delta
description: 3D field of Delta Deuterium (H-2) in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature)

name: CH3OH Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of CH3OH (Methanol, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CH4 column average dry air mixing ratio
description: 2D Column integrated number of molecules of the target gas (CH4, methane) divided by that of dry air expressed in mole fraction

name: CH4 mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of CH4 (Methane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CH4 Mole fraction (BG)
description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) CH4 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CH4 Mole fraction (SR)
description: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) CH4 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CH4 Tropospheric column
description: 2D field of total amount of CH4 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: ClO
description: 3D field of amount  of ClO (Chlorine monoxide = Hypochlorite, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: ClONO2
description: 3D field of amount of ClONO2 (Chlorine nitrate, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Cloud base height
description: Height of the bottom surface of the cloud

name: Cloud cover
description: 3D field of fraction of sky filled by clouds.

name: Cloud drop effective radius
description: Size distribution of liquid water drops, assimilated to spheres of the same volume. Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface.

name: Cloud ice
description: 3D field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not).

name: Cloud ice effective radius
description: Size distribution of ice particles, assimilated to spheres of the same volume.  Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface

name: Cloud ice Total Column
description: 2D Field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not), integrated over the total column.

name: Cloud liquid water (CLW)
description: 3D field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not).

name: Cloud liquid water (CLW) total column
description: 2D Field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not), integrated over the total column.

name: Cloud optical depth
description: Effective depth of a cloud from the viewpoint of radiation extinction. OD = exp(-K.Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ], Δz the vertical path [km] between the base and the top of the cloud and the reference wavelength to be specified in the metadata.

name: Cloud to Ground lightning density
description: Number of detected cloud-to-ground flashes in the corresponding time interval and the space unit. The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle

name: Cloud top height
description: Height of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds)

name: Cloud top pressure
description: Pressure at the top of the cloud

name: Cloud top temperature
description: Temperature of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds)

name: Cloud type
description: Result of cloud type classification - Accuracy expressed as inverse of number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: CO mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CO mole fraction (near surface)
description: 2D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

name: CO Total Column
description: 2D field of total number of CO modelcues (Carbon Monixide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth's  surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: CO Tropospheric column
description: 2D field of total amount of CO molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: CO2 column average dry air mixing ratio
description: 2D Column integrated number of molecules of the target gas (CO2, Carbon dioxide) divided by that of dry air expressed in mole fraction

name: CO2 flux
description: Flux of carbon dioxide from the surface to the atmosphere

name: CO2 mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of CO2 (Carbon dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CO2 Mole fraction (BG)
description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) CO2 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CO2 Mole fraction (SR)
description: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) CO2 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CO2 Tropospheric Column
description: 2D field of total amount of CO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: Coastal sea level (tide)
description: Deviation of sea level from local references in coastal zones, caused by local currents and tides (astronomical and wind-induced).

name: Coastlines
description: Location of coastlines  (Lat/Long)

name: Colour Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM)
description: Optically measurable component of the dissolved organic matter in water.

name: COS
description: 3-D field of amount  of COS (Carbonyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Cosmic ray neutron flux
description: Flux of neutrons near the surface of Earth due to collisions in the atmosphere of cosmic rays impacting Earth atmosphere from the Sun and outer space.

name: Cosmic ray neutron flux spectrum
description: Flux density energy spectrum of neutrons from the Sun or as component of the cosmic radiation.

name: Crustal motion (horizontal and vertical)
description: Changes in time of the position and height of the Earth plates.  Indicative of the lithosphere dynamics, thus useful for earthquake prediction  - Physical unit: [ mm/y ] - Accuracy unit: [ mm/y ].

name: Crustal plates positioning
description: Basis for monitoring the evolution of the lithosphere dynamics - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

name: Dew Point Temperature
description: Temperature to which air must be cooled to become saturated with water vapor  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata (K)

name: Dissolved inorganic carbon  (DIC)
description: The cumulated concentration of inorganic carbon species (dissolved carbon dioxide, carbonic acid, bicarbonate and carbonate) in solution.

name: DMS Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of DMS (Dimethyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Dominant wave direction
description: One feature of the ocean wave spectrum. It is the direction of the most energetic wave in the spectrum - Physical unit: [ degrees ] - Accuracy unit: [ degrees ].

name: Dominant wave period
description: The period of the most energetic wave in the ocean wave spectrum.

name: Downward long-wave irradiance at Earth surface
description: Flux density of radiation emitted by the gases, aerosols and clouds of the atmosphere to the Earth's surface

name: Downward short-wave irradiance at Earth surface
description: Flux density of the solar radiation at the Earth surface

name: Downward short-wave irradiance at TOA
description: Flux density of the solar radiation at the top of the atmosphere

name: Earth Rotation
description: Rotation velocity of the Earth, determining the length of the day - Physical unit: [Rad/s] - Accuracy unit: [Arcsec/century].

name: Earth surface albedo
description: Hemispherically integrated reflectance of the Earth surface in the range 0.4-0.7

name: Earth surface short-wave bidirectional reflectance
description: Reflectance of the Earth surface as a function of the viewing angle and the illumination angle in the range 0.4-0.7 . The distribution of this variable is represented by the Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function (BRDF)

name: Electric Field
description: Magnitude and direction of the Earth’s electric field

name: Electron Density
description: 3-D field of the electron density in the ionosphere

name: Electron differential directional flux
description: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle

name: Electron flux density
description: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

name: Electron flux energy spectrum
description: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

name: Electron integral directional flux
description: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.

name: Electrostatic charge
description: Measurement of the electrostatic charge of a satellite accumulated because of the environmental situation.

name: Energetic Neutral Atom (ENA)
description: Neutral atoms resulting from the capture of free electrons by positively ionized nuclei of the solar wind.  Once neutralised, the particles are no longer deviated by the interplanetary magnetic field, and still move very fast, travelling in an exact straight line.

name: EUV flux
description: Radiative flux integrated over the EUV band.

name: EUV flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the EUV band.

name: EUV sky image
description: EUV image of the sky

name: Evapotranspiration
description:
Quantity of water evaporated from
the soil and plants when the ground is at its natural moisture content.

name: Fire fractional cover
description: Fraction of a land area where fire is occurring

name: Fire radiative power
description: Power radiated by the fire occurring within an area

name: Fire temperature
description: Temperature of the fire occurring within an area

name: foEs
description: The highest ordinary-wave frequency reflected back from a sporadic E layer and observed by an ionosonde.

name: foF2
description: Critical frequency of the F2 layer of the ionosphere. This critical frequency (f, in MHz) is associated with the electron density (Ne, in cm-3): f=9*10-3*sqrt(Ne).

name: Fraction of Absorbed PAR (FAPAR)
description: Fraction of PAR absorbed by vegetation (land or marine) for photosynthesis processes (generally around the 'red' )

name: Fraction of vegetated land
description: Fraction of a land area where vegetation is present

name: Freezing level height in clouds
description: Height of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other

name: Gamma-ray flux
description: Radiative flux integrated over the gamma-ray domain.

name: Gamma-ray flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the gamma-ray domain.

name: Geoid
description: Equipotential surface which would coincide exactly with the mean ocean surface of the Earth, if the oceans were in equilibrium, at rest, and extended through the continents (such as with very narrow channels) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

name: Geomagnetic field
description: Magnitude and direction of the 3D magnetic field on the surface of Earth and within the magnetosphere (i.e., in low-Earth orbit and in geosynchronous orbit).

name: Glacier cover
description: Fraction of a land area covered by permanent ice

name: Glacier motion
description: Velocity of the ice measured at the surface of a glacier

name: Glacier topography
description: Map of the height of the glacier surface.

name: Glyoxal Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of OCHCHO (Glyoxal, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Glyoxal Tropospheric column
description: 2D field of tropospheric column averaged of amount of Glyoxal (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Gravity field
description: Indicative of the statics and dynamics of the lithosphere and the mantle - Physical unit: [ mGal ] where : 1 Gal = 0.01 m.s-2

name: Gravity gradients
description: Gradient of the Earth’s gravity field measured at the satellite orbital height - Physical unit: [ E ] , Eötvös (1 E = 1 mGal / 10 km) - Accuracy unit: [ E ].

name: Ground water
description: Amount of water present beneath the ground surface per unit area

name: h'F
description: Virtual height of the bottom of the ionospheric F-layer.

name: H2 Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of H2 ( expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: H2O
description: 3D field of amount of H2O (Water vapour intended as a chemical species relevant for atmospheric chemistry. expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: HCFC-22
description: 3D field of amount of HCFC-22 (hydrochlorofluorocarbon-22, or R-22expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: HCHO mole fraction
description: 2D field of amount of HCHO (Formaldehyde, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

name: HCHO Total Column
description: 2D field of total amount of HCHO molecules (Formaldehyde)  per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: HCHO Tropospheric column
description: 2D field of total amount of HCHO molecules (Formaldehyde)  per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: HCl
description: 3D field of amount of HCl (Hydrogen chloride, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: HD Delta
description: 3D field of Delta Deuterium (H-2) in HD (molecular Hydrogen) (isotopic signature)

name: HDO
description: 3D field of amount  of HDO (Water vapour (with one hydrogen nucleus replaced by its deuterium isotope) , expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Heavy ion angular flux energy and mass spectrum
description: Flux density energy and mass spectrum of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron, per unit solid angle

name: Heavy ion differential directional flux
description: Flux density of heavy ions (eavier than Helium) per unit solid angle

name: Heavy ion flux energy and mass spectrum
description: Flux density energy and mass spectrum of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron.

name: Heavy ion integral directional flux
description: Flux density of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron.

name: Height of the top of PBL
description: Height of the surface separating the PBL from the free atmosphere

name: Height of the tropopause
description: Height of the surface separating the troposphere from the stratosphere

name: Heliospheric image
description: Image of the interplanetary space between the Sun and Earth

name: hmF2
description: Altitude of the peak density in the ionospheric F2 layer.

name: HNO3
description: 3D field of amount of HNO3 (Nitric acid, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Hydrometeor type
description: 3D field of the predominant form of condensed water in a volume of free atmosphere, including liquid cloud, rain, ice crystals, snow, graupel and hail. (This variable replaces "precipitation type").

name: Ice sheet topography
description: Map of ice sheet height over land .

name: Icing potential
description: 3D field of super-cooled liquid water, enabling the formation of ice coating on an object.

name: Integrated Water Vapour (IWV)
description: Total amount of water vapour present in a vertical atmospheric column.

name: Interplanetary magnetic field
description: Vector magnetic field (3D) in the solar wind. The reference frame is Cartesian or Cylindrical with many different axis orientations. Important in Space Weather to monitor magnetic disturbances of the near earth environment.

name: Ionospheric plasma density
description: Total number of ionized particles in a volume unit of ionospheric plasma

name: Ionospheric plasma velocity
description: Velocity of bulk plasma or electrons (depending on measurement technique) as a function of altitude in the ionosphere.

name: Ionospheric Radio Absorption
description: Attenuation of a radio wave passing through the lower ionosphere.

name: Ionospheric Scintillation
description: Random fluctuations of radio waves resulting of small scale variations of the ionospheric electron density in space and time.

name: Ionospheric Vertical Total Electron Content (VTEC)
description: Number of electrons between two points.

name: Lake area
description: Aera extent of the surface of a lake

name: Lake level
description: Map of the height of the lake surface.

name: Lake Surface Temperature
description: Temperature of the lake surface - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].

name: Land cover
description: Processed from land surface imagery by assigning identified cluster(s) within a given area to specific classes of objects - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

name: Land surface temperature
description: Temperature of the apparent surface of land (bare soil or vegetation) - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].

name: Land surface topography
description: Map of land surface heights - Physical unit: [ m ] - Accuracy unit: [ m ].

name: Leaf Area Index (LAI)
description: LAI is the total one-sided area of photosynthetic tissue per unit ground surface area

name: Long-wave Earth surface emissivity
description: Emissivity of the Earth surface in the thermal IR, function of the wavelength

name: Melting layer depth in clouds
description: Depth of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other

name: Meteorological Optical Range (MOR) (surface)
description:
Length of path in the atmosphere required to reduce the luminous flux in a collimated beam from an incandescent lamp, at a colour temperature of 2 700 K, to 5 per cent of its original value, the luminous flux being evaluated by means of the photometric luminosity function of the International Commission on Illumination.  For aeronautical purposes, the surface MOR is measured at a height of 2.5 m above the surface. 
(Unit: m )

name: N(15)NO Delta
description: 3D field of Delta N-15 in N2O (Nitrous oxide) (isotopic signature)

name: N(15)NO-Alpha Delta
description: 3D field of Delta N-15 in Alpha-N2O (Nitrous oxide where the outer Nitrogen atom is N-15)  (isotopic signature)

name: N(15)NO-Beta Delta
description: 3D field of Delta N-15 in Beta-N2O (Nitrous oxide where the middle Nitrogen atom is N-15) (isotopic signature)

name: N2(18)O Delta
description: 3D field of Delta O-18 in N2O (Nitrous oxide) (isotopic signature)

name: N2O mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount  of N2O (Nitrous oxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: N2O mole fraction (BG)
description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) N2O (Nitrous Oxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: N2O mole fraction (SR)
description: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) N2O (Nitrous Oxide,  expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: N2O5
description: 3D field of amount of N2O5 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NH3 Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of  NH3 (Ammonia, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NH3 Total Column
description: 2D field of total amount of NH3 molecules (Ammonia) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: NIR/SWIR flux
description: Integrated NIR/SWIR flux

name: NIR/SWIR flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of diffuse NIR/SWIR flux measured in space

name: NIR/SWIR sky image
description: NIR/SWIR image of the sky

name: NO
description: 3D field of amount of NO expressed in moles divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NO2  Total Column
description: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: NO2 Mole  fraction (SR)
description: 3D field of amount of Source Region (SR) NO2 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NO2 mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of NO2 (Nitrogen dioxide,  expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: NO2 Mole fraction (BG)
description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) NO2 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NO2 mole fraction (near surface)
description: 2D field of amount of NO2 (Nitrogen Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

name: NO2 Stratospheric Column
description: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules (Nitrogen Dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the tropopause to the stratopause

name: NO2 Tropospheric column
description: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules ( Nitrogen Dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: NO3 Mole Fraction
description: 3D field of amount of NO3 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI)
description: Difference between maximum (in NIR) and minimum (around the Red) vegetation reflectance, normalised to the summation.  Representative of total biomass, supportive for computing LAI if not directly measured

name: O3
description: 3D field of amount of O3 (Ozone, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in air (also expressed in moles).

name: O3 mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of O3 (Ozone, expressed in moles) in the troposphere divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: O3 Stratospheric Column
description: 2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from tropopause to stratopause

name: O3 Total Column
description: 2D field of total amount of O3 molecules per unit area  in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere (Dobson units).

name: O3 Tropospheric Column
description: 2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the to the tropopause

name: Ocean chlorophyll concentration
description: Indicator of living phytoplankton biomass, extracted from ocean colour observation. Uncertainty is expressed in mg/m3 for a given concentration of 1 mg/m3 .

name: Ocean Diffuse Attenuation Coefficient (DAC)
description: Indicator of water turbidity and vertical processes in the ocean, extracted from ocean colour observation.

name: Ocean dynamic topography
description: Deviation of sea level from the geoid caused by ocean currents (after corrections for tides and atmospheric pressure effects) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

name: Ocean salinity
description: 3D field of salinity of the ocean  Requested in upper and deep ocean - Physical unit: [ psu ], Practical Salinity Unit, close to 1

name: Ocean subsurface dissolved oxygen concentration
description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen

name: Ocean subsurface tracers
description: Concentration of trace molecules such as tritium and CFCs

name: Ocean surface currents (vector)
description: Water flow on ocean surface - Physical unit: [ cm/s ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm/s ] intended as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.

name: Ocean suspended sediments concentration
description: Variable extracted from ocean colour observation. Indicative of river outflow, re-suspension or pollution of other-than-biological origin. Uncertainty expressed in g/m3 at a specific concentration (e.g., 2 g/m3 ).

name: Ocean temperature
description: 3D field of temperature of the ocean  Requested in upper and deep ocean.

name: Ocean velocity
description: Ocean motion measured at various depth levels.

name: OCS Mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of OCS (Carbonyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: OH
description: 3D field of amount of OH (Hydroxil radical, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Oil spill cover
description: Fraction of an ocean area polluted by hydrocarbons released from ships or off-shore platforms, accidentally or deliberately.

name: PAN
description: 3D field of amount of PAN (Peroxy Acetyl Nitrate, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: pCO2
description: Partial pressure of carbon dioxide at the surface of the sea

name: pH
description: The hydrogen ion concentration in seawater, which is a measure of acidity and alkalinity

name: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR)
description: Flux of downwelling photons of wavelength 0.4-0.7

name: Precipitation  (liquid or solid)
description: 3D field of the vertical flux of precipitating water mass (precipitation intensity)

name: Precipitation intensity at surface (liquid or solid)
description: Intensity of precipitation reaching the ground - Physical unit: [ mm/h ] (if solid, mm/h of liquid water after melting) - Accuracy unit: [ mm/h ]. Since accuracy changes with intensity, it is necessary to specify a reference intensity. Assumed rate: 5 mm/h.

name: Precipitation intensity at surface (solid)
description: Intensity of solid precipitation reaching the ground - Physical unit: [ mm/h ] (mm of liquid water after melting)

name: Precipitation type at the surface
description: The type of precipitation reaching the surface, including snow, rain, hail, dew, rime, hoar frost and fog precipitation.

name: Proton differential directional flux
description: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy protons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.

name: Proton integral directional flux
description: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy protons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

name: PSC occurrence
description: 3D field of Polar Stratospheric Clouds occurrence. - Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].  Simplified: [ FAR/HR]

name: Radiation Dose Rate
description: 3D field of the dose rate of energetic particles

name: Radiation profile
description: Vertical profile of upward and downward LW and SW radiation components

name: Radio-waves
description: Travelling radio-waves of solar, galactic and extragalactic origin, entering the Earth’s environment.

name: Relative humidity
description: 3D field of relative humidity in the atmosphere. Relative humidity is the ratio of the amount of atmospheric moisture present relative to the amount that would be present if the air were saturated with respct to water or ice to be specified in the metadata

name: Relative Humidity (near surface)
description: Relative  humidity  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata.Relative humidity is the ratio of the amount of atmospheric moisture present relative to the amount that would be present if the air were saturated with respect to water or ice to be specified in the metadata

name: River discharge
description: Volume of water flowing through a river per unit of time

name: Sea surface heat flux
description: Sea Surface Heat Flux

name: Sea surface height anomaly
description: Sea surface height anomaly

name: Sea Surface Mass Flux
description: Sea Surface Mass Flux

name: Sea surface salinity
description: Salinity of sea water in the surface layer (upper ~ 1 m if observed in MW).  In the open ocean the correct term should be  “halinity” with reference of the diversity of salts involved.

name: Sea surface temperature
description: Temperature of the sea water at surface.   The “bulk” temperature refers to the depth of typically 2 m, the “skin” temperature refers to within the upper 1 mm.

name: Sea-ice cover
description: Fraction of an ocean area where ice is present

name: Sea-ice elevation
description: Elevation of the surface of the sea-ice sheet above sea level

name: Sea-ice motion
description: Sea-ice motion

name: Sea-ice surface characteristics
description: Sea-ice surface characteristics (albedo, meltpond, dust, snow properties, temperature)

name: Sea-ice surface temperature
description: Temperature of the surface of sea-ice.

name: Sea-ice thickness
description: Thickness of the ice sheet. It is related to sea-ice elevation and ice density

name: Sea-ice type
description: Variable convolving several factors (age, roughness, density, etc.) - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes^-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

name: SF6
description: 3D field of amount  of SF6 (Sulfur hexafluoride,   expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: Short-wave cloud reflectance
description: Reflectance of the solar radiation from clouds

name: Significant wave height
description: Average amplitude of the highest 30 of 100 waves.

name: Snow cover
description: Fraction of a given area which is covered by snow

name: Snow depth
description: Vertical distance from the snow surface to the underlying surface (ground, glacier ice or sea ice).

name: Snow status (wet/dry)
description: Binary product (dry or melting/thawing) expressing the presence of liquid water in a snow layer- Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].

name: Snow water equivalent
description: Vertical depth of the water that would be obtained by melting a snow layer.  Linked to snow depth through the density of the snow layer.

name: SO2 mole fraction
description: 3D field of amount of SO2 (Sulfur dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: SO2 mole fraction (near surface)
description: 2D field of amount of SO2 (Sulfur dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

name: SO2 Total Column
description: 2D field of total amount of SO2 molecules (Sulfur dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere

name: SO2 Tropospheric Column
description: 2D field of total amount of SO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: Soil moisture  (in the roots region)
description: Sub-soil 3D field of the fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Requested from surface down to ~ 3 m

name: Soil moisture at surface
description: Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Surface layer (upper few centimetres)

name: Soil temperature
description: The standard depths for soil temperature measurements are 5, 10, 20, 50 and 100 cm below the surface; additional depths may be included. The site for such measurements should be a level plot of bare ground (about 75 cm^2 ) and typical of the surrounding soil for which information is required.

name: Soil type
description: Result of the classification of different types of soil within an area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: Solar Ca II-K image
description: Image of the Sun in the K-line of Ca-II  (393.4 nm)

name: Solar coronagraphic image
description: Image of the solar corona surrounding the Sun.

name: Solar electric field
description: Map of magnitude and direction of the electric field at the solar surface (photosphere).

name: Solar EUV flux
description: Integrated EUV flux over the solar disk

name: Solar EUV flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the EUV flux integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar EUV image
description: Images of the Sun in the Extreme Ultra-Violet (EUV) wavelengths in order to identify features such as filaments, active regions and coronal holes.

name: Solar gamma-ray flux
description: Integrated gamma-ray flux over the solar disk

name: Solar gamma-ray flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the gamma-ray flux integrated over the solar disk

name: Solar H-alpha image
description: Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen-alpha transition wavelength (656.3 nm).

name: Solar Lyman-alpha flux
description: Solar flux in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)

name: Solar Lyman-alpha image
description: Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)

name: Solar magnetic field
description: Vector magnetic field (1D or 3D) at the solar surface (photosphere/chromosphere)

name: Solar radio flux
description: Integrated radio flux over the solar disk.

name: Solar radio flux spectrum
description: Solar radio flux energy spectrum integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar radio image
description: 2D image of the solar radio flux

name: Solar spectral irradiance
description: Total Solar Irradiance (TSI); when measured as a function of wavelength it is the spectral irradiance

name: Solar UV flux
description: Integrated UV flux over the solar disk.

name: Solar UV flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the UV flux integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar UV image
description: Images of the Sun in the UV wavelengths.

name: Solar velocity fields
description: Map of 3D velocity of particles of the Solar atmosphere, significant of the Sun interior.

name: Solar VIS flux
description: Integrated VIS flux over the solar disk

name: Solar VIS flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the integrated VIS flux over the solar disk.

name: Solar VIS image
description: Images of the Sun in the VIS wavelengths.

name: Solar white light image
description: Image of the Sun in white light

name: Solar wind density
description: Density of solar wind plasma

name: Solar wind temperature
description: Temperature of solar wind protons

name: Solar wind velocity
description: Vector velocity of solar wind plasma

name: Solar X-ray flux
description: Integrated X-ray flux over the solar disk

name: Solar X-ray flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the X-ray flux integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar X-ray image
description: Image of the Sun in X-ray wavelengths

name: Specific humidity
description: 3D field of the specific humidity in the atmosphere. The specific humidity is the ratio between the mass of water vapour and the mass of moist air.

name: Spread F
description: Vertical thickness of highly structured ion density in the F-region of the ionosphere.

name: Temperature of the tropopause
description: Atmospheric temperature at the height of the surface separating the troposphere from the stratosphere

name: Total alkalinity (AT)
description: The amount of acid necessary to titrate all weak bases in seawater.

name: Total lightning density
description: Total number of detected flashes in the corresponding time interval and the space unit. The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle

name: Turbulence
description: 3D field of kinetic energy density of turbulent motion of the air

name: Upward long-wave irradiance at Earth surface
description: Flux density of terrestrial radiation emitted by the Earth surface

name: Upward long-wave irradiance at TOA
description: Flux density of terrestrial radiation emitted by the Earth surface and the gases, aerosols and clouds ot the atmosphere at the top of the atmosphere

name: Upward short-wave irradiance at TOA
description: Flux density of solar radiation, reflected by the Earth surface and atmosphere, emitted to space at the top of the atmosphere

name: Upward spectral radiance at TOA
description: Upward radiant power measured at the top of the atmosphere per area unit, per solid angle, and per wavelength interval. Spectral range 0.2-200 µm. Resolving power ?/??= 1000. Accuracy quoted as SNR (Signal-to-Noise-Ratio), actually SNR^-1 so that smaller figure means better performance, as usual.

name: UV flux
description: Integrated UV flux.

name: UV flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of diffuse UV flux measured in space.

name: UV sky image
description: UV image of the sky

name: Vegetation type
description: Result of the classification of different types of vegetation within a vegetated area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: VIS flux
description: Integrated VIS flux

name: VIS flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of diffuse VIS flux measured in space

name: VIS sky image
description: VIS image of the sky

name: Water-leaving spectral radiance
description: Upward spectral radiance from the ocean surface, i.e. amount of light leaving the ocean per unit area, per wavelength and per solid angle.

name: Wave 1D energy frequency spectrum
description: 1D variable colloquially referred to as “wave spectrum”. Describes the wave energy in each frequency band (e.g. 25 frequency bands) regardless of the direction of propagation

name: Wave directional energy frequency spectrum
description: 2D variable colloquially referred to as wave spectrum. Describes the wave energy travelling in each direction and frequency band (e.g., 24 distinct azimuth sectors each 15° wide, and 25 frequency bands)

name: Wetland extent
description: Fraction of an area flood by water

name: Wind (horizontal)
description: 3D field of the horizontal vector component (2D) of the 3D wind vector. The acuracy is meant as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.

name: Wind (vertical)
description: 3D field of the vertical component of the 3D wind vector

name: Wind direction (near surface)
description: Direction from which wind is blowing at a known height above the surface which is to be specified in the metadata

name: Wind gust
description: Maximum value, over the observing cycle, of the 3-second running average wind speed

name: Wind speed (near surface)
description: Speed of air at a known height above the surface which is to be specified in the metadata

name: Wind stress
description: The shear force per unit area exerted by wind blowing over the sea surface -

name: Wind vector (near surface)
description: Horizontal wind vector, at a known height above the surface which is to be sprcified in the metadata

name: X-ray flux
description: Integrated X-ray flux.

name: X-ray flux spectrum
description: Energy spectrum of the integrated X-ray flux.

name: X-ray sky image
description: X-ray image of the sky

name: Geothermal energy
description: Geothermal energy is heat derived from Earth's interior. Resources include hot springs and wells, hot dry rock, and even molten rock. These may be converted into heat and electricity.

name: Solar-induced chlorophyll fluorescence (SIF)
description: Solar induced chlorophyll fluorescence (SIF) is an electromagnetic signal emitted by the chlorophyll a of assimilating plants: part of the energy absorbed by chlorophyll a is not used for photosynthesis, but emitted at longer wavelengths as a two-peak spectrum roughly covering the 650–850 nm spectral range. The SIF signal responds instantaneously to perturbations in environmental conditions such as light and water stress, which makes it a direct proxy for photosynthetic activity. However, SIF emission constitutes only a small fraction (typically 0.5%-2%) of the radiance at the top of the canopy, which is mostly composed of reflected sunlight, and its estimation from space-borne spectrometers requires both high spectral resolution and advanced retrieval schemes.
